New South Wales Department Of Corrective Services (DCS): The NSW DCS, Australia is a department of the Government of New South Wales with responsibility for the supervision of adult offenders on community-based or custodial orders issued by the courts and their mission is to managing offenders in a safe, secure and humane manner and reduces risks of re-offending.
Project Description: An important function of the TECM (Throughcare Electronic Case Management) model is the idea of a Capacity Management. A Capacity Management is a housing location management that follows the offender throughout their entire booking, regardless of whether or not they are in an Institution or in the Community. This approach permits case plan owners to take into consideration an offender’s entire sentencing period when developing a Capacity Management, and also allows subsequent Capacity Management owners to be able to view the history of the offender’s progress and build onto it as necessary.
